title: Newtons first law - box lowered at constant speed

content.question: A person holds a string that is attached to a box. The person allows the box to move straight downward at a constant speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, as shown. The weight of the box is <math alttext="5 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>. Which of the following claims about the tension in the string is correct?

choices.label: The tension must be less than <math alttext="5 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math> but greater than zero.
The tension must be equal to <math alttext="5 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>.
The tension must be greater than <math alttext="5 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>.

content.answer: The tension must be equal to <math alttext="5 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
